definition: thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress

sentences.english: Second, you must not be shy, be thick-skinned, and speak up.
sentences.chinese: 其次，别害羞，脸皮厚一点，大声说出来。

sentences.english: I am now so thick-skinned that such incidents hardly fuss me at all.
sentences.chinese: 我现在的脸皮厚得很，这样的情形对我已经无所谓了。

sentences.english: Sometimes you'll just have to deal with Internet meanies and grow that thick skin.
sentences.chinese: 有事你只是需要对待网络刻薄鬼并且变得脸皮厚一点。
论脸皮厚，你可算是天下第一。

sentences.english: He's really thick-skinned, Insults roll right off his back;
sentences.chinese: 他真是脸皮厚，羞辱的话他是毫不在乎。

sentences.english: You need a thick skin to be a headmaster.
sentences.chinese: 要当校长，你就得脸皮厚一些。

sentences.english: She has had so much criticism by now that she has learned how to be thick-skinned.
sentences.chinese: 她受到太多的批评谴责，只是她学会了脸皮厚而已。

sentences.english: The smelly man who looking at these thick-skinneds, snow Niang found out a target a while.
sentences.chinese: 看着这群脸皮厚的臭男人，雪娘一下子找到了目标。

sentences.english: It's really time to grow a thicker skin.
sentences.chinese: 真是到了该脸皮厚一点的时刻了。

definition: to have no sense of shame/shameless
to know no shame/to be totally shameless
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
to regard face as all-important/to consider loss of face unthinkable
